image.altText: A police car outside National Zoo and Aquarium.

props.synopsis: ACT police and emergency services were called to the Canberra zoo about 12:50pm today after reports of a disturbance, where they found the woman dead, apparently as a result of stab wounds, in a commercial kitchen area.

title.children: Canberra woman found dead from suspected stabbing at National Zoo and Aquarium

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann outside court.

props.synopsis: Brittany Higgins's former chief of staff at Parliament House Fiona Brown was allowed to give evidence to Bruce Lehrmann's defamation trial in a closed court session.

title.children: Brittany Higgins's former chief of staff says it entered her mind she may have been raped after meeting with Bruce Lehrmann

image.altText: The exterior of the court, showing the sign and the crest.

props.synopsis: The man allegedly sexually assaulted the teenage girl in the stairwell of a popular Canberra nightclub before allegedly raping her outside in a laneway.

title.children: Irish man accused of raping 16-year-old in Canberra arrested while preparing to leave Australia

image.altText: Water tot he roofs in Wujal Wujal.

props.synopsis: Premier Steven Miles says rain and cloud in Far North Queensland has hampered efforts to airlift residents of Wujal Wujal to an evacuation centre, but another attempt will be made on Tuesday morning.

title.children: Authorities postpone evacuation of flooded Wujal Wujal, Cairns Airport runway cleared but flights yet to resume

image.altText: Navy personnel rescuing people from flooded homes in Cairns

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology says rainfall has been easing around Cairns but the emergency continues for already-waterlogged areas of Queensland's Far North. Follow live.

title.children: 'Intense rainfall' to ease as defence force deployed to rescue stranded residents in flooded Far North Queensland

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Man's death in Holloways Beach 'not as a result' of floods
BOM says rainfall beginning to ease, 'we're not seeing that intense rainfall anymore'
'Incredible acts of bravery': Fishing boats, mustering choppers rallied for rescues

image.altText: A plane with Turkish Airlines branding flies over a dense cityscape.

props.synopsis: Transport Minister Catherine King quietly approves expanded services for Turkish Airlines, including flights to stop-over destinations, despite earlier rejecting a similar request made by Qatar.

title.children: Turkish Airlines approved for massive expansion of flights to and from Australia, following Qatar rejection

image.altText: An elderly caucasian in a blue suit, red tie, speaking into a microphone with an American flag in the background.

props.synopsis: Speaking at a rally in Nevada, Donald Trump also calls US President Joe Biden a "low-IQ individual" and the "worst, most incompetent and most corrupt president" in the history of the United States.

title.children: Trump promises 'largest deportation operation in American history' if elected

image.altText: ADF deployed as severe weather continues to hit North Queensland

props.synopsis: As heavy rain starts to ease across north Queensland, and evacuations get underway, locals are wondering how a relatively low-level category cyclone turned into such chaos.

title.children: Emergency services say Queensland's intense flooding was 'unexpected'. So what happened?

image.altText: Ella holding a toy that belonged to Jesse when he was little.

props.synopsis: Parents with violent children can face a heartbreaking decision: give them up or continue to live in danger. Experts say more needs to be done to help families facing complex situations.

title.children: 'The fear is that Jesse will kill me one day': This mother faces a heartbreaking decision to relinquish care

image.altText: Woman in purple dress sitting on seat outside house with stone featuring patting cream coloured dog, doghouse in left corner.

props.synopsis: South Australia ranks worst in the country in a national tradie shortage that's keeping critical state housing empty, as vulnerable people face a bleak Christmas with no home to call their own.

title.children: Ally is at the top of the rental list in a town with 48 empty social houses, but she could be waiting three more years

image.altText: The Matildas celebrate in Melbourne

props.synopsis: A first Olympic medal is on the radar for the Matildas, who will face Uzbekistan in Melbourne on February 28 to decide which nation qualifies for Paris.

title.children: Melbourne-bound Matildas have Olympic medal firmly in their sights

image.altText: A ship crew member stands on a submarine with the US flag in the background

props.synopsis: Experts weigh in on plans for low-level radioactive waste to be stationed at a Perth defence base, as the Premier suggests it can be sent elsewhere.

title.children: Radioactive waste from nuclear AUKUS submarines will be stored in Perth. Is there any cause of concern?

image.altText: Singer Jimmy Barnes smiling with his wife asfter surgery

props.synopsis: The 67-year-old enjoys some fresh air and a family lunch after having open-heart surgery to address a bacterial infection last week.

title.children: Jimmy Barnes all smiles during first Sunday roast since open-heart surgery

image.altText: Rugby players running across a field.

props.synopsis: Rugby league is widely loved in Papua New Guinea — it's even the national sport. And if their bid to become the 18th team in the NRL is successful, there could be benefits for Australia beyond the field.

title.children: 'A national unity strategy': Inside Papua New Guinea's bid to become the 18th team in the NRL

image.altText: two female students carrying handbags walk through a university campus. they are facing away from the camera

props.synopsis: Researchers who examined the experience of students leaving school and pursuing further education find young people are facing increasing pressure to attend university.

title.children: High school students 'burnt out' from increasing pressure to attend university

image.altText: Two border guards escort a group of migrants carrying backpacks as they walk in the snow

props.synopsis: As Finland again shuts its border to Russia, Putin serves a reminder he is not afraid to pressure other states with promises of a military base near the border as he stands accused of a "hybrid operation" against the Baltic state.

title.children: Migrants become a pawn in what Finland says is a Russian 'hybrid operation' on its border

image.altText: Christopher Luxon in parliament, pointing and looking quite cross.

props.synopsis: In three weeks, New Zealand's new prime minister has moved to wind back policies designed to improve outcomes for Māori and Pasifika people, and people are taking to the streets.

title.children: 'It's an absolute disgrace': In three weeks, NZ's new PM has reignited race relations

image.altText: Papua New Guinea police officers watch on as hundreds of students marched towards the university gate in Port Moresby

props.synopsis: Chiefs and community leaders in Bougainville want an investigation into police officers over their alleged involvement in arming and orchestrating an organised crime gang that targeted people who had travelled to the autonomous region to buy guns and gold.

title.children: In Bougainville, the 'wanted boys' are known for robbing cashed-up visitors. Police are allegedly orchestrating it

image.altText: The Queensland cabinet appointed by new premier Steven Miles on the steps of Government House

props.synopsis: Days after he became premier, Steven Miles's first cabinet has been sworn in today with five fresh faces joining the frontbench and three Palaszczuk ministers heading to the backbench. Follow live.

title.children: Steven Miles reshuffles Queensland cabinet with fresh faces and no dedicated Olympics portfolio

image.altText: Sign in Hebrew in red food

props.synopsis: Israel's military says it found the signs, made from leftover food, in a building near where the incident happened, as the families of the dead lay blame.

title.children: Israel's military says hostages killed by IDF made SOS signs

image.altText: A drone shot of a cat napping holding a salmon drawn with rice plants.

props.synopsis: A Thai rice farmer has worked with an artist and hundreds of helpers to turn his property into works of art.

title.children: Napping cats have taken over this Thailand rice farm

image.altText: A blue and white sign with the initials 'FMG' on it.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's largest mining companies settles a dispute with WA's workplace safety regulator over whether it had to hand over documents relating to sexual harassment at three of its mine sites.

title.children: FMG settles dispute over sexual harassment documents, pledges to improve culture among executives

image.altText: A small cylindrical black speak-like object sits on a kitchen counter top.

props.synopsis: Researchers are investigating whether Amazon's Alexa, Apple's Siri or Google Home speakers should be used to detect violence in homes.

title.children: Smart speakers offer 'unprecedented opportunity' to tackle domestic violence, but raise ethical issues

image.altText: Flooded world showing a Ferris Wheel and a woman in a small boat.

props.synopsis: Video games had a bumper 2023, but the Australian games industry is suffering through one of its worst contractions since the global financial crisis, with lay-offs and studio closures predicted to continue across 2024. What's going on?

title.children: 'Survive until 25': Australian video game studios brace for grim year ahead

image.altText: A hand holding a $100 note next to a wallet

props.synopsis: Australia's inflation struggle and cost-of-living crisis will be front and centre as 2023 ends and a new one begins, keeping the Reserve Bank back in the national economic driver's seat for another year, writes David Taylor.

title.children: Australia's economic crisis will be front and centre as 2023 ends. But will 2024 be more prosperous?

image.altText: Two women wear traditional Hazara headscarves and clothing.

props.synopsis: Hazara women Zahra Anvari and Gol Nazari settled in Tasmania as refugees seven years ago after decades of persecution. But after a violent incident, the day-to-day fear of discrimination continues.

title.children: Attackers try to rip headscarfs from Hobart mother and daughter

image.altText: Bushfire burns orange and red on the horizon at night against the silhouette of a windmill, as stars twinkle above in a dark sky

props.synopsis: A bushfire in the Pilliga State Forest near Narrabri is threatening lives and properties in Bohena Creek between McCanns Road, Perimeter Road, Tomlinson Lane and the Newell Highway.

title.children: Residents told to seek shelter as NSW bushfire spanning 81,000 hectares upgraded to emergency level

image.altText: Sea turtle hatchling sitting in the palm of a man's hand

props.synopsis: The precarious location of a rare Mid North Coast loggerhead turtle nest prompted rescuers to act quickly to give any hatchlings the best chance of survival.

title.children: Rare loggerhead turtle eggs moved from path of dangerous king tides
